data.name: Dictionary Attack
data.description:
## Dictionary attack

![Hacker](https://i.gifer.com/5HJ3.gif)

You got your hacker fingers on a users table from the Evil Corp, available in global scope as:

```
const dataTable = {
  users: [
    {
      id: "id-1",
      name: "John",
      surname: "Doe",
      hash: "fe1a9218de8f369d",
      favoriteColor: "blue",
    },
    ...
  ]
}
```

As an experienced hacker over the years you have gathered known passwords and their hashes and stored them in a dictionary, (password as the key and hash as the value) available in global scope as:

```
const hashDictionary = {
mySecretPassword: "8d2c6f1ed3f17d42",
...
};
```

### Your task:

Write a function **getPasswords** that takes an array of user ids and returns an array of user objects with key value pair for their password appended.

e.g:

```
getPasswords(['id-1']) --->  [{
      id: "id-1",
      name: "John",
      surname: "Doe",
      hash: "fe1a9218de8f369d",
      favoriteColor: "blue",
      password:'1234567'
    }]
```

Your code should handle 0-n ids in.

If user is not found return null in its place

```
[null]
```

If password is not found return user object with empty string in the password value

```[{
      id: "id-100",
      name: "John",
      surname: "Doe",
      hash: "fe1a9218de8f36d",
      favoriteColor: "blue",
      password:''
    },]
```

It should only return unique users


Good luck :)
